    Governor Hochul Announces MTA Signs ‘equity in Infrastructure Project’ Pledge to Support Historically Underutilized Businesses published Mar 07, 2024
  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency Governor
    Governor Hochul Announces Funding Now Available to Support Electric School Bus Charging Infrastructure published Mar 05, 2024

    FCC Issues Formal Notice That April Is Final Full Month of ACP Program published Mar 04, 2024
  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT)
    Biden-Harris Administration Sends Another $9.9 Billion from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to Transit Agencies Across the Country published Feb 29, 2024
  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
    Biden-Harris Administration announces over $1 billion to start new cleanup projects and continue work at 100 Superfund sites across the country published Feb 27, 2024

    EPA Announces Bipartisan Infrastructure Law Funds for Cleanups at Two Superfund Sites in New York published Feb 27, 2024

    Interior Department Announces $195 Million for America’s National Parks through President Biden’s Investing in America Agenda published Feb 27, 2024

Federal Guidance Updates

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT)
    Biden-Harris Administration Takes Major Step to Boost Domestic Manufacturing in Transportation, Create Good-Paying American Jobs published Mar 07, 2024

    On March 7th, the U.S. Department of Transportation’s Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) announced a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) to discontinue its general waiver of Buy America requirements for manufactured products used in federal-aid highway projects.

  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency U.S. Department of the Treasury
    U.S. Department of the Treasury, IRS Release Final Rules on Provisions to Expand Reach of Clean Energy Tax Credits Through President Biden’s Investing in America Agenda published Mar 05, 2024

    On March 5th, the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) released final rules on key provisions in the Inflation Reduction Act to expand the reach of the clean energy tax credits and help build projects more quickly and affordably, which will create good-paying jobs and lower energy costs for families.

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency U.S. Department of Transportation’s Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA)
    Biden-Harris Administration Opens Applications for Over $180 Million in Safety Grants for Commercial Motor Vehicles published Mar 04, 2024

    On March 4th, the U.S. Department of Transportation’s Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA) announced the availability of more than $180 million in grants to promote roadway safety.

  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency Environmental Protection Agency
    Biden-Harris Administration invests $3B into clean ports as part of President Biden’s Investing in America agenda published Feb 28, 2024

    On February 28th, Environmental Protection Agency announced the availability of $3 billion through the IRA’s Clean Ports Program to fund zero-emission port equipment and infrastructure to tackle the climate crisis and improve air quality at U.S. ports. The funding will advance environmental justice by reducing diesel pollution from U.S. ports in surrounding communities, all while creating good-paying jobs.

  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) & U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA)
    DOE, USDA Launch Initiative to Help Farmers Reduce Costs with Underutilized Renewable Technologies as part of President Biden’s Investing in America Agenda published Feb 26, 2024

    On February 26th, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) and the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) launched a new initiative to help farmers cut costs and increase income using underutilized renewable technologies including smaller-scale wind projects.

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency Department of the Interior (DOI)
    Interior Department Releases Draft Guidance for States to Access up to $1.5 Billion from President Biden’s Investing in America Agenda to Address Legacy Pollution published Feb 23, 2024

    On February 23rd, the U.S. Department of the Interior today released draft guidance to states on how to apply for up to $30 million each in matching grant funding available under President Biden’s Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to create jobs and clean up polluting and unsafe orphaned oil and gas wells across the country.
